trans-unit.source: Represents a reference in a discovery document to an XML Schema Definition (XSD) language schema.
This class cannot be inherited.
XML Web services discovery involves discovering the available XML Web services given, a URL.
A The URL typically points to a discovery document, which usually has a.disco file name extension.
The discovery document contains references to information about the existance of XML Web services.
These references can refer to service descriptions, XSD schemas, or other discovery documents.
This class represents a reference to an XSD schema.
Within a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element.
The `schemaRef` XML element has an XML namespace and a `ref` attribute.
The value of the XML namespace must match the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Namespace> constant.
The value of the `ref` attribute is placed in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Ref%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference"></xref> class using default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference"></xref> class using the supplied URL as the XSD schema reference.
Gets the name of the default file to use when saving the referenced XSD schema.
Default name to use when saving the referenced XSD schema to a file.
XML namespace for XSD schema references in discovery documents.

Within a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element, which is a part of the XML namespace specified in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Namespace> constant.
Reads and returns the XSD schema from the passed <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
<xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> containing the XSD schema.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> containing the contents of the referenced XSD schema.
Gets or sets the URL to the referenced XSD schema.
In a discovery document, a reference to an XSD schema is contained within a `schemaRef` XML element.
The `schemaRef` XML element has a `ref` attribute, which is the URL for the referenced XSD schema.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference.Ref%2A> property represents the value of the `ref` attribute.
The URL for the referenced XSD schema.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets an <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> object representing the XSD schema.

If the XSD schema has not been downloaded and added to the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol.Documents%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference.ClientProtocol%2A>, an attempt to download and resolve the document is made.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> object representing the XSD schema.
<xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference.ClientProtocol"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-
An error occurred during the download or resolution of the XSD schema using <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference.ClientProtocol"></xref>.
Gets or sets the `targetNamespace` XML attribute of the XSD schema.
The `targetNamespace` XML attribute of the XSD schema.
The default value is `null`.
Gets or sets the URL for the schema reference.

For the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference> class, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Url%2A> property returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.SchemaReference.Ref%2A> property.
The URL for the referenced XSD schema.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Writes the passed XSD schema into the passed <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The to write into stream.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> into which the serialized XSD schema is written.
